intro: Diplotaxis harra subsp. crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf synedrella, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its robust, hairy stems and basal leaves that are thick and succulent, adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
